reviews.text: OK, it is not the Ritz, but it could be worse.
reviews.title: Not the worst if looking for cheap LGA accomodation

reviews.text: Pros: cheap, (for New York), big continental breakfast (included bagels, muffins, cereal, porridge etc) on the house, proximity to LGA and car rental, nor as dirty as other similar hotels, staff were very friendly, efficient and helpful to me, free wi-fi - a rarity in New York!
reviews.title: Perfectly fine hotel for transit, $18 for parking

reviews.text: Cons: close to runways, thin bedding.
reviews.title: Just do yrself a favour and DON'T STAY HERE

reviews.text: Ignore the negative reviews on this place - I don't know what people are expecting from a basic hotel next to the airport when you need to stay overnight or need a convenient place to be able to get to the airport early
reviews.title: Dirty

reviews.text: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for an unexpected trip and did not want to spend $$$. After the name was revealed, I saw extremely negative reviews everywhere and was apprehensive.
reviews.title: Close to LGA airport, nothing else to offer.
You get what you pay for....
reviews.text: This is a good little spot for those with early/late flight times. Airport shuttle is very quick, so location is top notch. Need to bear in mind that this is a 3 star airport hotel, not The Ritz. Yes, it's old and dated, and the hallways might be a bit musty. But the room is clean, the sheets are clean and crisp, and given you're next to an airport it's pretty quiet so you can get some decent sleep. We decided to venture downstairs for a drink at the bar, and were pleasantly surprised by really chatty and kind bar staff. Ended up staying down much longer than we thought just enjoying the company and good conversation. If reasonably priced overnight airport accomodation is what you're looking for, then that's exactly what's provided.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is fine and pretty clean (not spotless, but I am picky). The rooms are good-sized. Although we heard no airport noise, there was some noise from a nearby freeway (but this is not the country!). Five minute shuttle to the airport runs every 1/2 hour.
reviews.title: Good location, fast shuttle service

reviews.text: First off, no handicap parking. The main entrance to lobby is not handicap accessible. Rooms have not been updated in a very long time. The tv is from the 90's and the hotel only has 12 channels, NONE of which carried any Yankees games, who where in the playoffs at the time of the visit. This includes the bar, not only are there only 12 channels but they are grainy and at best you can make out 1/2 the show.
reviews.title: Stay somewhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shower head was installed by someone under five feet tall, needed to bend over to wash hair! And I'm only 5'6"!
reviews.title: A good deal for airport parking

reviews.text: Then there is the crappy wi-fi, apparently being in a room towards the end of hotel puts you too far away for having use of the wi-fi.
reviews.title: One night stayover

reviews.text: i stayed at this hotel 11/12/12 and the hotel was very dirty, carpets in the hallways wher stained, rooms wher not clean, the tv only got two channles, yup just two. to top it all off the first room i was given had no heat. when i talked to the lady at the front desk she said " we turned off the heat because it was too hot" it was 40 degrees outside so they moved me to a diff. room with heat located on the other side of the hotel. she did offer me more blankets though. haha and as mentioned in other reviews the rooms do have a smell of their own. the breakfast was a joke and the bar/restaurant isnt much better. if you do decide to stay at this hotel i hope you enjoy it more than i did.
reviews.title: dont stay at this hotel unless quality doesnt matter

reviews.text: Each room I was shown smelled like sewage. Unfortunately I had pre-paid on a "blind" sight where I didn't know the name of the hotel in advance so I was stuck. This is not a three star. It is an uninhabitable two star. Thespis carpets are old and stained and the TVs are from the Year One.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here

reviews.text: I attended the Borough Park Symposium this past week and was impressed with this hotel. The event was hosted by the Airport LaGuardia Hotel. My job takes me all over the world and I get to stay in some really nice hotels (most of the time)--so I know what a good hotel should be. This is a good hotel. Yes, it's old (but so is the Waldorff), and it's not fancy (as other reviewers have noted), but it's clean and the rooms are spacious. Yes, the TVs are old and the wireless Internet is a bit sluggish--but for me, those aren't deal-breakers (I didn't come to NYC to watch TV). For the price, I really don't think you can beat it. (If you want flat screen TV and all of the amenities, stay at the luxurious Ritz and spend $400+ a night.) Someone complained in a review that the hotel shuttle passed her up at the airport. Of course they did--they have to drop people off at the terminals before they circle back around and pick up newcomers! My experience with the shuttle was outstanding. As other reviewers have noted, the drivers are helpful and friendly. Bottom line: great place to stay near LaGuardia Airport.
reviews.title: Can You Believe a Rating of 5 for a 3 Star Hotel?

reviews.text: What a very affordable place to spend the night, park your car for a week while you fly off to a vacation getaway. Room, though small, was clean and fit our needs fo0r the one night. I think I would feel cramped if I had to stay longer. Parking was easy and on-site. Check in was also very easy. Free shuttle service was especially efficient. They left on the half hour and once we boarded the shuttle we were at the airport counter within 5 minutes. The return shuttle was equally smooth. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Ideal Park, Stay, Fly Option at LGA

reviews.text: The Hotel was clean, friendly, and well located to airport with a shuttle. The driver of the shuttle offered to drop us off at a resturant of our choice on his route to and from the airport between shuttle service runs. All associated with the hotel were very helpfull. It served our needs well and I would recommend it to all as a good value for the money. If in the area again I will stay here again...Thanks to all at the hotel....
reviews.title: A Quick overnight stay

reviews.text: It's fine for a short overnight in the Laguardia area. The hotel is a 3 minute hotel van ride from the terminal. The staff is pleasant. The bed was clean, shower hot, flat screen TV received all the channels. The hotel was quiet, no airport noise. There is a small gym. There is a small bar/restaurant for dining and a fair continental breakfast is included. It is not the Ritz. It is an older chain hotel now owned by a private company. The location and price are it's forte.
reviews.title: it's fine

reviews.text: A handy location if you have an early flight from LaGuardia; and if your room is on the airport side, it's fun to watch planes & traffic. Room was clean and spacious, free breakfast a plus, and shuttle service was excellent. The cafe service needs some improvement - only 1 person working and she was more interested in talking with other customers.
reviews.title: Handy Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used this hotel as a staging post prior to our cruising from NY. We both found the staff very helpful and extremely polite. The breakfast was a nice surprise, normally the free breakfasts are not very good, this was the exception, very good and plentiful. Excellent shuttle service to and from airport.
reviews.title: Would Stay Again

reviews.text: My daughter and I went to New York for her 15th birthday (her first time in NY) and I have to say, the hotel was excellent... At first I wasnt very sure of staying so far from Manhattan, but Im glad we did. Lakisha who checked us in was wonderful and very pleasant, Ms. Michelle Manzano whom I met when we checked out was a delight and of course the housekeeper too. I enjoyed having dinner at the hotel even though there was not much to choose from the waitress-bartender-bus lady she did it all she was hilarious. There was also a gentleman who also worked in restaurant-bar he has light colored eyes, he too was very nice and informative on places to go. Most of all we enjoyed our ride on the bus as well as subway into the city. Now how can I forget the shuttle drivers, there were all pleasant. Overall I have to say I would DEFINATELY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!! We had such a great four day vacation!! Thank you very much!!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: The LaGuardia Airport Hotel is the best! Highly recommended for my next stay in New York. I enjoyed exploring the city on my own and loved the Topaz guided tour of the city. The breakfast buffet is amazing and the restaurant food is quality and delicious. Try the nachos and French onion soup. After a day of sightseeing it was refreshing and enjoyable to have a few beers at Happy Hour where you can have excellent conversation with the very charming bartenders and guests. My room was very comfortable and the housekeeping staff were excellent. I met many kind and interesting people during my visit and I would like to thank the staff of the LaGuardia Airport Hotel, the people of the city of New York and everyone I met who was also visiting for a wonderful adventure.
reviews.title: Thank You New York
